can someone review this and make sure everything is compatible? Also is the OEM HDD something to worry about since its OEM? and does DDR2 800 ram work with that motherboard and would DDR2 1066 ram be worth it?

item.title: Review my byopc config
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:9, topic:250237”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=330000.msg2580367#msg2580367 date=1229229721]
The RAM has nothing to do with the processor, that motherboard requires 1066 RAM and thats what you need to put in there, or it won’t run.
[/quote]

Actually, for that mobo hes right. It wants 1066 for AM2+ and 800 or less for AM2. Says so right on the spec page :P[/quote]

I don’t see it anywhere, did you mean this spec page?

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16813157139 (click specifications)

Read full topic

Moparisthebest:

The RAM has nothing to do with the processor, that motherboard requires 1066 RAM and thats what you need to put in there, or it won’t run.

Actually, for that mobo hes right. It wants 1066 for AM2+ and 800 or less for AM2. Says so right on the spec page

item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

http://www.asus.com/products.aspx?l1=3&l2=149&l3=758&l4=0&model=2409&modelmenu=2

switched to this mobo since you can’t install anything in the pci express 1x slot since a heatsink is in the way.

looks like it supports 800

isn’t ddr2 backwards compatible anyway?

Read full topic

item.title: Review my byopc config
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:5, topic:250237”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=330000.msg2579597#msg2579597 date=1229189384]
Everything is compatible except for the RAM, you have to get 1066 ram for that mobo.

I suggest:

newegg.com

HyperX 2GB (2 x 1GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066 (PC2 8500)...

Buy HyperX 2GB (2 x 1GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066 (PC2 8500) Dual Channel Kit Desktop Memory Model KHX8500D2K2/2GR with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!


If you need to save a few bucks you could go with this:
newegg.com

Wintec AMPX 2GB (2 x 1GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066 (PC2...

BuyWintec AMPX 2GB (2 x 1GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066 (PC2 8500) Dual Channel Kit Desktop Memory Model 3AXT8500C5-2048Kwith fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Otherwise the only other comment I have is I don’t like Western Digital hard drives, I find Seagate the same price and much higher quality.
[/quote]
AM2 only supports 800 ram. 1066 is for the AM2+ (ie phenom)[/quote]

The RAM has nothing to do with the processor, that motherboard requires 1066 RAM and thats what you need to put in there, or it won’t run.

And I LOVE MSI products, I have used them from the beginning and find them to be super-high quality. I’ve been building computers for 7 years and never once had anything from MSI malfunction. I only buy MSI motherboards and get MSI graphics cards when I can.

As far as Seagate goes, I’ve had about 8 WD’s go bad over the years, 1 Maxtor (which I also like), and 0 seagates. I currently have 5 Seagate harddrives in my desktop right now and love them.

Read full topic

item.title: Review my byopc config
item.dc:creator: @RXVL RXVL
item.description:
@RXVL wrote:

chrisn2323:

whats wrong with the msi? the reviews look good for it

MSI has horrible customer support, and their products in general are very cheap and flimsy. They tend to break very easily and you have to go through so much shit to get them replaced. Buy EVGA.

Read full topic

item.description:

If you need to save a few bucks you could go with this:
newegg.com

Wintec AMPX 2GB (2 x 1GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066 (PC2...

BuyWintec AMPX 2GB (2 x 1GB) 240-Pin DDR2 SDRAM DDR2 1066 (PC2 8500) Dual Channel Kit Desktop Memory Model 3AXT8500C5-2048Kwith fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

Otherwise the only other comment I have is I don’t like Western Digital hard drives, I find Seagate the same price and much higher quality.[/quote]
AM2 only supports 800 ram. 1066 is for the AM2+ (ie phenom)

[quote=“RXVL, post:4, topic:250237”]Umm… MSI makes shitty products, don’t buy their GFX cards. Go with some Corsair DDR2 1066 RAM, Corsair is the shit. And I have to agree with MITB, Seagate > WD, I’ve had 7 WD drives crap out on computers I’ve built, and never once have I had a problem with Seagate for the 20+ times I’ve used their products.

EDIT:2GB Corsair DDR2 1066 RAM: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16820145043 ($15 after MIR)[/quote]
whats wrong with the msi? the reviews look good for it

Umm… MSI makes shitty products, don’t buy their GFX cards. Go with some Corsair DDR2 1066 RAM, Corsair is the shit. And I have to agree with MITB, Seagate > WD, I’ve had 7 WD drives crap out on computers I’ve built, and never once have I had a problem with Seagate for the 20+ times I’ve used their products.
